project.teaser: GIANCE offers innovative solutions to environmental challenges and establishes a holistic, integrated, and industrial-driven platform for the design, development, and scalable fabrication of the next generation of cost-effective, sustainable, lightweight, recyclable graphene...
project.objective: GIANCE offers innovative solutions to environmental challenges and establishes a holistic, integrated, and industrial-driven platform for the design, development, and scalable fabrication of the next generation of cost-effective, sustainable, lightweight, recyclable graphene and related materials (GRM)-based multifunctional composites, coatings, foams, and membranes (GRM-bM) with enhanced properties (e.g. thermal, mechanical, chemical), functionalities (e.g. wear, corrosion, chemical and fire resistance, hardness and impact resistance, high temperature resistance, structural health monitoring, ultralow friction surfaces), and as enablers for hydrogen storage. GIANCE will also advance manufacturing processes, enhancing synthesis and stability and reducing environmental impact. Such GRM-bM and manufacturing capabilities will allow robust connections with end-users and thus develop and qualify the commercial propositions to high TRLs. GIANCE will develop, demonstrate, and validate the efficacy of GRM-enabled products (11 use cases) which will underlie future technologies for different sectors (e.g. automotive, aerospace, energy (hydrogen economy) and water treatment). GIANCE also supports the innovation output and industrialization efforts of the Graphene Flagship initiative, building a credible pathway for the newly accumulated knowledge to impact EU industry and society. GIANCE will support a strong EU value chain in translating technology advances from TRL4-5 into concrete innovation opportunities and production capabilities (TRL6-7), with first-mover market advantages of scale in the defined industrial sectors. The consortium consists of 23 partners from 10 countries, representing the full value chain, with leading OEMs, large industries, world-class research and education organisations, and innovative SMEs. GIANCE is designed to ensure maximum impact for the defined industries and society as a whole, significantly contributing to the evolving field of GRM.
project.title: Graphene Alliance for Sustainable Multifunctional Materials to Tackle Environmental Challenges
project.keywords: Graphene, 2DM, composites, coatings, foams, membranes, eco-design, multifunctionality, upscaling, industrial demos, testing&validation, environmental challenges, sustainability, recyclability, LCA

article.title: Sustainable graphene and GRM-based multifunctional materials

result.title: Water-soluble photocatalysts based on porphyrin-carbon dot conjugates produce H<sub>2</sub> under visible light irradiation

details.authors: Katerina Achilleos, Anna Katsari, Emmanouil Nikoloudakis, Foteini Chatzipetri, Dimitris Tsikritzis, Kalliopi Ladomenou, Georgios Charalambidis, Emmanuel Stratakis, Athanassios G. Coutsolelos

result.title: Open science and data management, sharing plan, and agreement
result.description: Preliminary version of the Data Management Plan (DMP). Open sciences and data management plant; Protecting the data while they are being collected, processed, analysed, and backed-up; Ensuring that data obeys with legal regulations; Regular reporting to the consortium; Monitoring and evaluating database performance; Improving the technology used building new databases.

details.authors: Emmanouil Nikoloudakis; Athanassios G. Coutsolelos; Emmanuel Stratakis

result.title: Initial Exploitable results and exploitation activities
result.description: First annual report of identification and definition of exploitable outputs and results of the project and their related business models for ensuring a successful market readiness stage beyond the project’s completion.

result.title: Initial Liaison report
result.description: A preliminary mapping of relevant (at least 20) EU initiatives, platforms and networks that could help maximising GIANCE’s impact on EDC. Methodology for exchanging outputs and ideas is set up based on best practices, including communication among related stakeholders.

result.title: Screening LCC of all UCs
result.description: Life cycle costs will be assessed for the identified UCs, including the CAPEX and OPEX costs across all life cycles stages. Data collection will be done together with the LCA to ensure consistency.

result.title: Screening LCA of all UCs
result.description: LCI data for the assessment of the identified UCs will be collected according to the defined goal and scope of the LCA and LCC study using a consistent data collection sheet.

result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation
result.description: A first draft of the dissemination and exploitation of project results, detailing the target audience, dissemination methodology, editorial to schedule communications, exploitation strategies, definition of KPIs to measure success and a strategy to monitor progress; A full strategy for digital communication and the visual identity of the project.

result.title: Initial Dissemination and communication activities
result.description: First annual report on communication and dissemination contains a run-down of all activities taken in the past year and serves at the same time in detailing the work plan for the upcoming year. It offers the opportunity to check all KPIs in detail, adjust editorials and modify communication strategies if needed.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - GIANCE (Graphene Alliance for Sustainable Multifunctional Materials to Tackle Environmental Challenges)
result.teaser: Europe stands at a pivotal moment in the development and deployment of advanced materials. Driven by growing demands across key sectors such as automotive, aerospace, energy, and water treatment, the need for smart, multifunctional materials has never been more pressing. The...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Visual identity kit
result.description: The Visual Identity Kit (VIK) comprises of the launch of a dedicated GIANCE website and social media profiles (e.g. Twitter, LinkedIn, Youtube) as well as the distribution of templates amongst the consortium partners (presentations and written reports); A full strategy of the visual identity

result.title: Goal and scope definition for LCA and LCC
result.description: The goal and scope definition in line with ISO14040 series to enable a comparable assessment of the potential environmental impacts and economic costs of the different UCs.

result.title: Industrialization assessment
result.description: Assessment of a specific GRM-bM and its performance and manufacturing requirements will be carried out and specific issues related to the handling on GRMs will be analyzed. A portfolio will be exploited, suitable for different applications in selected UCs and tailored to the final component performance required.

result.title: Initial Support of GF and other initiatives report
result.description: First report on the contribution of GIANCE to the Governance and Coordination of the GF Initiative, considering the activities performed in the Coordination, Standardisation, Roadmap, Innovation and Dissemination working groups

result.title: Environmental, technical and performance requirements of components
result.description: Requirements will be identified and summarised to build protocols to develop and test the UCs based on end-user needs, standardization goals, and performance, focusing on identification of the lightweighting, structural integrity, recyclability targets, and environmental impact, as well as the operational conditions, that describe the UCs functional performance.

result.title: Advancements in printed components for proton exchange membrane fuel cells: A comprehensive review

details.authors: Guilherme Paixão da Costa, Diogo M.E. Garcia, Thi Hai Van Nguyen, Paul Lacharmoise, Claudia D. Simão

result.title: Framework for development and upscale of GRM, products and process
result.description: Analyse the UCs requirements and develop a sustainable GRM manufacturing framework. Upscaling of production rate as well as process monitoring and control, cost savings, and safety will be considered.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
